summary: The document is a part of the John F. Kennedy Records Collection, specifically an identification form related to the JFK assassination system. It details a national agency check request for Edward Kaczmarczyk, including his personal history, family background, residences, employment, travels, naturalization in the United States, and service in the US Army. The document also notes his travels to the USSR, Poland, England, and Canada, and mentions a period of detention in the USSR. It is marked as 'RELEASED WITH DELETIONS' and was last reviewed on 03/09/95.
key_findings: The document is related to the JFK assassination records collection.
It contains a national agency check request for Edward Kaczmarczyk, including detailed personal and familial information.
Edward Kaczmarczyk was naturalized in the United States and served in the US Army.
The document notes his travels, including visits to the USSR, Poland, England, and Canada, and mentions a period of detention in the USSR.
The form is marked as 'RELEASED WITH DELETIONS' and was last reviewed on 03/09/95.
